thread.title: New coaches getting fast results with Falcons, Broncos, Jets
thread.title_full: New coaches getting fast results with Falcons, Broncos, Jets

title: New coaches getting fast results with Falcons, Broncos, Jets
text:
Updated: 6:04 p.m. Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015 | Posted: 6:04 p.m. Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015 New coaches getting fast results with Falcons, Broncos, Jets Related Minnesota Vikings head coach Mike Zimmer, right, greets Denver Broncos head coach Gary Kubiak after an NFL football game Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015, in Denver. (AP Photo/Joe Mahoney) Sponsored Links 
Dan Quinn cranked up the music and turned up the energy for the Atlanta Falcons. 
So far, the results have been nothing short of amazing. 
After winning only 10 games the last two seasons, the Falcons are 4-0 for their new coach. 
It's much the same in New York, where Todd Bowles has the Jets sitting at 3-1. Gary Kubiak took over a winning team in Denver and kept it going, guiding the Broncos to a perfect start through the first month of the season. 
This is not all that unusual. 
A check of the last 20 years by The Associated Press showed that two-third of coaches who took over before the start of a season led their new team to a better record than the previous year. 
___
